segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 14. Yodhājīvavagga
segments.en: 14. A Warrior

segments.pli: 140. Assakhaḷuṅkasutta
segments.en: 140. A Wild Colt

segments.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisakhaḷuṅke.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you about three wild colts and three wild people.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo assakhaḷuṅkā?
segments.en: “What are the three wild colts?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: One wild colt is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: Another wild colt is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: While another wild colt is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo assakhaḷuṅkā.
segments.en: These are the three wild colts.

segments.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo purisakhaḷuṅkā?
segments.en: And what are the three wild people?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: One wild person is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: Another wild person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: While another wild person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
segments.en: And how is a wild person fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re fast, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho saṃsādeti, no vissajjeti.
segments.en: But when asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering.

segments.pli: Idamassa na vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re not beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Na kho pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: And they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: This is how a wild person is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
segments.en: And how is a wild person fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re fast, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
segments.en: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

segments.pli: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Na pana lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: But they don’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
segments.en: This is how a wild person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?
segments.en: And how is a wild person fast, beautiful, and well proportioned?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Idamassa javasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re fast, I say.

segments.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
segments.en: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

segments.pli: Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Lābhī kho pana hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: They receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Idamassa ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
segments.en: This is how a wild person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo purisakhaḷuṅkā”ti.
segments.en: These are the three wild people.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.
